events.message: The insured reported a car collision on the morning of May 1st involving a rear-end impact at a traffic signal.
Based on the description mentioning vehicle collision, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to facilitate communication and claim handling.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been officially acknowledged by the insurer.
The insurer requested the accident report, photos of the vehicle damage, and police report for further verification.
The insured submitted all requested documents including the police report, photographs of the damaged car, and witness statements.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted materials to assess liability and damage extent.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault and that the damages warrant full claim approval.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering all damages and repair costs to the insured vehicle.
The insured responded with appreciation for the quick assessment and fair settlement offer.
Management approved the claim for payout based on the investigation findings and agreed settlement.
The settlement payment was processed and issued to the insured's designated bank account promptly.
After issuing payment, the claim was formally closed with confirmation sent to the insured.
All claim records and documents related to the auto accident were archived electronically for future reference.
